thread.title: Modou Barrow Departs Swansea for Leeds United Loan Until End of Season
thread.title_full: Modou Barrow Departs Swansea for Leeds United Loan Until End of Season | 90min

author: Leeds United
title: Modou Barrow Departs Swansea for Leeds United Loan Until End of Season
text:
​Swansea City winger Modou Barrow will be finishing his season on loan at Leeds United, with the clubs agreeing over a move on Tuesday. Leeds United have now confirmed that the player has signed a loan deal to play for the club until the end of the 2016/17 campaign via their official website. ✍️ #LUFC are pleased to confirm our second signing of the day, with @modoubarrow14 joining the club. Read more at https://t.co/728UcrrUnX pic.twitter.com/YMqeX9sytE — Leeds United (@LUFC) January 31, 2017 Leeds boss Garry Monk signed Barrow from Ostersunds FK in 2014, while he was manager at Swansea. And the pair will work together again at least until the end of the season. A statement on Leeds' official website reads: " Leeds United are pleased to confirm a second transfer deadline day signing, with Modou Barrow joining the club. "The 24-year-old joins the Whites on loan until the end of the season from Premier League side Swansea City. "The attacker will be unavailable for Wednesday's trip to Blackburn Rovers on Wednesday, but like fellow deadline day signing Alfonso Pedraza could make his debut in Sunday's West Yorkshire derby with Huddersfield Town." The 24-year-old was born in Gambia, but moved to Sweden as a youth. He once received a call up to represent the Swiss national side, but could not deliver because of an unfortunate and untimely injury. He has since decided to play for his country of birth, and has made five appearances for the Gambia national team so far.

Who Is the Worst Ever January Signing in EPL History?

Andy Carroll (Newcastle United to Liverpool for £35m 2011)

Christopher Samba (Anzhi Makhachkala to QPR for £12.5m 2013)

Fernando Torres (Liverpool to Chelsea for £50m 2011)

Jean-Alain Boumsong (Rangers to Newcastle United for £8.3m 2005)

Konstantinos Mitroglou (Olympiakos to Fulham for £12m 2014)

Savio Nsereko (Brescia to West Ham United for £9m 2009)
